item.title: Authorizing the limited use of the United States Armed Forces in support of the NATO mission in Libya.

latestAction.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

item.title: To limit the use of funds appropriated to the Department of Defense for United States Armed Forces in support of North Atlantic Treaty Organization Operation Unified Protector with respect to Libya, unless otherwise specifically authorized by law.

latestAction.text: On passage Failed by recorded vote: 180 - 238 (Roll no. 494).

item.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 240 - 167 (Roll no. 492). (text: CR H4534)
Passed/agreed to in House: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 240 - 167 (Roll no. 492).(text: CR H4534)
The previous question was ordered without objection. (consideration: CR H4540)
DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 328.
Considered as privileged matter. (consideration: CR H4534-4540)
Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 48.

The rule provides one hour of dbeate on H.J.Res. 68 with 40 minutes equally divided and controlled by the chair and ranking minority member of the Committee on Foreign Affairs and 20 minutes equally divided and controlled by the chair and ranking minority member of the Committee on Armed Services. All points of order against consideration and provisions are waived.
The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 112-114, by Mr. Woodall.
The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 112-114, by Mr. Woodall.

summary.text: Sets forth the rule for consideration of the joint resolution (H.J. Res. 68) authorizing the limited use of the United States Armed Forces in support of the NATO mission in Libya; and providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 2278) to limit the use of funds appropriated to the Department of Defense for United States Armed Forces in support of North Atlantic Treaty Organization Operation Unified Protector with respect to Libya, unless otherwise specifically authorized by law.

bill.title: Providing for consideration of the joint resolution (H.J. Res. 68) authorizing the limited use of the United States Armed Forces in support of the NATO mission in Libya; and providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 2278) to limit the use of funds appropriated to the Department of Defense for United States Armed Forces in support of North Atlantic Treaty Organization Operation Unified Protector with respect to Libya, unless otherwise specifically authorized by law.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
